6. Tasks in CamCOPS by category¶

Warning

Copyright details (and any special restrictions) are given below on the pages pertaining to individual tasks. If you think a task is here in error (i.e. that we have erred in our assesment of its copyright status), please contact us immediately (at rudolf@pobox.com).

6.1. Clinical notes and logs¶

  • Body mass index (BMI)
  • Contact log
  • CPFT Liaison Psychiatry Service admin tools: referral, response clock, discharge (experimental)
  • Diagnostic coding, ICD-10 codes
  • Friends and Family Test (FFT)
  • Identify and Rate the Aim of the Contact (IRAC)
  • Patient Satisfaction Scale
  • Photograph
  • Photo sequence
  • Progress note
  • Psychiatric clerking
  • Referrer Satisfaction Scale (patient-specific version)

6.2. Global function and multiple aspects of psychopathology¶

  • Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale (BPRS)
  • Brief Psychiatric Rating Scale, Expanded (BPRS-E)
  • Bristol Activities of Daily Living Scale (BADLS)
  • Cambridge Behavioural Inventory, Revised (CBI-R)
  • Clinical Global Impression scale (CGI)
  • Clinical Global Impression – Improvement (CGI-I)
  • Brief COPE Inventory (COPE_Brief)
  • Dementia Quality of Life measure, self-report version (DEMQOL)
  • Dementia Quality of Life measure, proxy version (DEMQOL-Proxy)
  • Disability Assessment for Dementia scale (DAD)
  • Distress Thermometer
  • Frontotemporal Dementia Rating Scale (FRS)
  • Global Assessment of Functioning (GAF)
  • Health of the Nation Outcome Scales: HoNOS
  • Health of the Nation Outcome Scales: HoNOS 65+
  • Health of the Nation Outcome Scales: HoNOSCA
  • Neuropsychiatric Inventory Questionnaire (NPI-Q)
  • RAND 36-Item Short Form Health Survey 1.0 (RAND-36)
  • Short Warwick–Edinburgh Mental Well-Being Scale (SWEMWBS)
  • Warwick–Edinburgh Mental Well-Being Scale (WEMWBS)
  • Work and Social Adjustment Scale (WSAS)
  • Zarit Burden Inventory (ZBI), 12-item version

6.3. Cognitive assessment¶

  • Addenbrooke’s Cognitive Examination, revision 3 (ACE-III)
  • Montreal Cognitive Assessment (MoCA)
  • National Adult Reading Test (NART)
  • Saint Louis University Mental Status (SLUMS) Examination

6.4. Affective (mood and anxiety) disorders¶

  • Beck Depression Inventory (BDI)
  • Clinical Interview Schedule, Revised (CIS-R)
  • Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7)
  • Geriatric Depression Scale, 15-item version (GDS-15)
  • Hamilton Rating Scale for Anxiety (HAM-A)
  • Hamilton Depression Rating Scale (HDRS) / Hamilton Rating Scale for Depression (HRSD, HAM-D)
  • Hamilton Depression Rating Scale, 7-item version (HAMD-7)
  • Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS)
  • Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale (HADS) (respondent version)
  • ICD-10 criteria: depressive episode
  • ICD-10 criteria: manic/hypomanic episode
  • ICD-10 criteria: mixed affective episode
  • Impact of Event Scale – Revised (IES-R)
  • Panic Disorder Severity Scale (PDSS)
  • PTSD Checklist (PCL-C)
  • PTSD Checklist (PCL-M)
  • PTSD Checklist (PCL-S)
  • Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)
  • Patient Health Questionnaire-15 (PHQ-15)
  • Penn State Worry Questionnaire (PSWQ)
  • Yale–Brown Obsessive Compulsive Scale (Y-BOCS)
  • Y-BOCS Symptom Checklist (Y-BOCS-SC)

6.5. Drug/alcohol abuse and addiction¶

  • Alcohol Use Disorders Identification Test (AUDIT)
  • AUDIT Alcohol Consumption Questions (AUDIT-C)
  • CAGE Questionnaire
  • Clinical Institute Withdrawal Assessment for Alcohol Scale, Revised (CIWA-Ar)
  • Drug Abuse Screening Test (DAST)
  • Fast Alcohol Screening Test (FAST)
  • Michigan Alcohol Screening Test (MAST)
  • Short Michigan Alcohol Screening Test (SMAST)

6.6. Executive functioning¶

  • INECO Frontal Screening (IFS)

6.7. Psychosis¶

  • Community Assessment of Psychic Experiences (CAPE-42)
  • Cardiff Anomalous Perceptions Scale (CAPS)
  • Clinical Global Impression – Schizophrenia (CGI-SCH)
  • ICD-10 criteria: schizophrenia
  • ICD-10 criteria: schizotypal disorder
  • Positive and negative syndrome scale (PANSS) for schizophrenia

6.8. Catatonia and extrapyramidal side effects¶

  • Abnormal Involuntary Movement Scale (AIMS)
  • Movement Disorder Society-Sponsored Revision of the Unified Parkinson’s Disease Rating Scale (MDS-UPDRS)

6.9. Personality and childhood experience¶

  • ICD-10 criteria: specific personality disorders
  • ICD-10 criteria: schizotypal disorder (as above)
  • Childhood Experience of Care and Abuse Questionnaire (CECA-Q3)

6.10. Research tasks (experimental)¶

  • Cardinal RN — Threshold predetermination for Expectation–Detection task
  • Cardinal RN — Expectation–Detection task (with associated sound test)
  • Deakin JB — 1 — Antibody-mediated psychosis study
  • Diagnostic coding, ICD-9-CM codes (compatible with DSM-IV-TR)
  • Khandaker GM — 1 — Insight — Medical history
  • Quality of Life: time trade-off and rating scale
  • Quality of Life: standard gamble
  • Three-dimensional intradimensional/extradimensional set-shifting task (IDED-3D)

6.11. Anonymous questionnaires¶

  • Referrer Satisfaction Scale (survey version)
  • UK General Medical Council (GMC) Patient Questionnaire

6.12. Set menus for research¶

Individual research projects may have specific menus of tasks created. As well as generic tasks listed above, there are some specific ones:

  • Deakin JB — 1 — Antibody-mediated psychosis study — health review
  • Khandaker GM — 1 — Insight study — medical history

6.13. Set menus for clinical purposes¶

Individual clinical services or contexts may have specific menus of tasks created. Amongst them:

6.13.1. FROM-LP menu¶

Generic:

  • Clinical Global Impression – Improvement (CGI-I)
  • Friends and Family Test (FFT)
  • Identify and Rate the Aim of the Contact (IRAC)
  • Patient Satisfaction Scale (PSS)
  • Referrer Satisfaction Scale (survey version)
  • Referrer Satisfaction Scale (patient-specific version)

Disease-specific:

  • Addenbrooke’s Cognitive Examination, revision 3 (ACE-III)
  • AUDIT Alcohol Consumption Questions (AUDIT-C)
  • Body mass index (BMI)
  • Generalized Anxiety Disorder Assessment (GAD-7)
  • Health of the Nation Outcome Scales: HoNOS
  • Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9)

6.14. Demonstration task¶

  • Demonstration questionnaire

6.15. Some tasks not in CamCOPS¶

  • Tasks NOT included, including for copyright reasons
